Functions, except for software upgrade and software debug, under the Maintenance Operations Mode shall operate concurrently without precluding or excluding any of the other functions in accordance with allowable operations as determined by the appropriate levels of interaction.
Shutdown State

Shutdown of the Tactical Control System shall include storage as well as deletion, as specified by the operator, of mission data files, shutdown of appropriate functions, shutdown of HCIs, and proper termination of all active interfaces.
There shall be no modes of operation in the shutdown state.

requirement specifications
safety requirements
para 5.3 of MIL-STD 882C
“System Safety Program Requirements”
Appropriate cautions and warnings shall be provided to the operator if the air vehicle deviates into unsafe flight regime
capable of restoring power in sufficient time to avoid loss of air vehicle control during power outages
provide protection against injury to Tactical Control System operators and maintenance personnel
The system design shall use MIL-STD-2036, as a guide, with regard to personnel hazards, and MIL-STD-1472D, as a guide for safety from a human engineering viewpoint.
Risk levels and a program to manage the probability and severity of hazards shall also be developed.
be accredited by the Designated Approving Authority
processing classified data
processing sensitive unclassified data

Links that provide communications between the Tactical Control System and other systems shall be secured in a manner appropriate for the sensitivities of the material passed through such links, in accordance with DoD Directive C-5200.5, “Communication Security (COMSEC)” dated 21 April 1990
shall be approved for operation at the same level as the systems with which it interfaces
cleared to the highest sensitivity of the data
capable of operation within environments
shall be capable of being scaled
shall be modular
to meet the varying needs
full independent computer redundancy
sufficient throughput to support the processing requirements
growth requirements
The Tactical Control System shall be capable of restoring power in sufficient time to avoid loss of critical mission data and loss of air vehicle control during power outages
shall have an uninterrupted power supply for critical phases (landing and takeoff as a minimum) of mission execution
throughput shall not exceed 50% of the throughput capability delivered over any 10 second period
throughput shall not exceed 25% of throughput capability delivered over any 10 second period
providing a 50% spare memory storage capacity over delivered storage used
a 75% spare memory storage capacity over storage used shall be provided

When performing a given task during mission execution
the operator shall be given appropriate warning messages
Warning messages shall be color coded and flashed based on mission criticality
A combination of visual and auditory outputs will be provided to alert the Tactical Control System operator to situations which may require operator response.
The position of the displayed message window shall be easily adjustable by the operator to ensure that important mission data is not obscured
All Tactical Control System warning messages and HCI actions shall be archived for later review
